Acrophobics might want to skip Canada's newest attraction.
Jutting 30 meters from the edge of a cliff in the Jasper National Park,...
...the Glacier Skywalk allows brave visitors a stunning view of the Canadian Rockies...
...and a 280-meter drop right below their feet.
The observation deck, which took about three years to plan and build,...
...was constructed from steel, glass and wood,...
...and a lack of paint and other toxic finishes...
...allows it to boast a near zero carbon footprint.
Finally open to the public this month over the Sunwapta Valley.
No refunds from the snack shack if vertigo gets the best of you.
